subject: Politics
title: Deliberative Democracy
description: Learn Deliberative Democracy in one minute.

hook.text: What if democracy was about reasoning together, not just counting votes? Deliberation might make better decisions.

buildup.text: Deliberative democracy says legitimate decisions come from informed public discussion, not just majority preference.

discovery.text: Citizens' assemblies in Ireland used deliberation to resolve abortion and marriage equality â€” issues that split MPs.

twist.text: Critics say deliberation favors the educated and articulate. Quiet people and marginalized groups get drowned out.

climax.text: Digital tools could scale deliberation. But social media currently rewards outrage, not thoughtful discussion.

punchline.text: Voting counts heads. Deliberation changes minds. Democracy needs both.

quiz.question: How did Ireland use deliberative democracy successfully?
options: Citizens' assemblies resolved divisive issues like abortion and marriage equality
Ireland banned all voting in favor of deliberation
Politicians debated issues with no public involvement
